intro: Alnus imperialis, commonly known as the imperial alder, is a species of flowering plant in the family Betulaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in the mountainous regions of California and Oregon. The tree is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and oval-shaped leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. It produces small, yellowish catkins that are important for pollination and provide food for various wildlife species. This plant plays a significant role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems in its native habitat.
